gateway.buffer-size-range: Buffer size should be greater than 0
gateway.attribute-filter-hint: Filter for incoming attribute name from platform, supports regular expression.
gateway.path-to-CA-cert-required: Path to CA certificate file is required.
gateway.change-connector-text: Switching connectors will discard any unsaved changes. Continue?
gateway.command-copied-message: Docker command has been copied to clipboard
gateway.docker-label: Use the following instruction to run IoT Gateway in Docker compose with credentials for selected device
gateway.install-docker-compose: Use the instructions to download, install and setup docker compose
gateway.device-name-filter-hint: This field supports regular expressions to filter incoming data by device name.
gateway.delete-mapping-title: Are you sure you want to delete the mapping related with '{{name}}'?
gateway.delete-mapping-description: Be careful, after the confirmation mapping configuration and all related data will become unrecoverable.
gateway.delete-slave-title: Are you sure you want to delete the server '{{name}}'?
gateway.delete-slave-description: Be careful, after the confirmation server configuration and all related data will become unrecoverable.
gateway.delete-device-title: Are you sure you want to delete the device '{{name}}'?
gateway.delete-device-description: Be careful, after the confirmation the device configuration and all related data will become unrecoverable.
gateway.launch-docker-compose: Start the gateway using the following command in the terminal from folder with docker-compose.yml file
gateway.create-new-gateway-text: Are you sure you want create a new gateway with name: '{{gatewayName}}'?
gateway.configuration-delete-dialog-body:
Turning off Remote Configuration is possible only if there is physical access to the Gateway. All previous configurations will be deleted.

To turn off configuration, enter gateway name below
gateway.connector-duplicate-name: Connector with such name already exists.
gateway.JSON-hint: Converter for this payload type processes MQTT messages in JSON format. It uses JSON Path expressions to extract vital details such as device names, device profile names, attributes, and time series from the message. And regular expressions to get device details from topics.
gateway.bytes-hint: Converter for this payload type designed for binary MQTT payloads, this converter directly interprets binary data to retrieve device names and device profile names, along with attributes and time series, using specific byte positions for data extraction.
gateway.custom-hint: This option allows you to use a custom converter for specific data tasks. You need to add your custom converter to the extension folder and enter its class name in the UI settings. Any keys you provide will be sent as configuration to your custom converter.
gateway.path-to-client-cert-required: Path to client certificate file is required.
gateway.data-mapping-hint: Data mapping provides the capability to parse and convert the data received from a MQTT client in incoming messages into specific attributes and time series data keys.
gateway.opcua-data-mapping-hint: Data mapping provides the capability to parse and convert the data received from a OPCUA server into specific data keys.
gateway.device-node-hint: Path or identifier for device node on OPC UA server. Relative paths from it for attributes and time series can be used.
gateway.extension-hint: Put your converter classname in the field. Custom converter with such class should be in extension/mqtt folder.
gateway.extension-configuration-hint: Configuration for converter. These arguments will be passed as a config to convert function.
gateway.fill-connector-defaults-hint: This property allows to fill connector configuration with default values on it's creation.
gateway.from-device-request-settings-hint: These fields support JSONPath expressions to extract a name from incoming message.
gateway.to-device-response-settings-hint: For these fields you can use the following variables and they will be replaced with actual values: ${deviceName}, ${attributeKey}, ${attributeValue}
gateway.gateway-exists: Device with same name is already exists.
gateway.grpc-keep-alive-timeout-min: Keep alive timeout can not be less then 1
gateway.grpc-keep-alive-timeout-pattern: Keep alive timeout is not valid
gateway.grpc-keep-alive-min: Keep alive can not be less then 1
gateway.grpc-min-time-between-pings-required: Min time between pings is required
gateway.grpc-min-time-between-pings-min: Min time between pings can not be less then 1
gateway.grpc-min-time-between-pings-pattern: Min time between pings is not valid
gateway.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data: Min ping interval without data (in ms)
gateway.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data-requ: Min ping interval without data is required
gateway.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data-min: Min ping interval without data can not be less then 1
gateway.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data-patt: Min ping interval without data is not valid
gateway.grpc-max-pings-without-data-required: Max pings without data is required
gateway.grpc-max-pings-without-data-min: Max pings without data can not be less then 1
gateway.grpc-max-pings-without-data-pattern: Max pings without data is not valid
gateway.inactivity-check-period-seconds-min: Inactivity check period can not be less then 1
gateway.inactivity-check-period-seconds-pattern: Inactivity check period is not valid
gateway.inactivity-timeout-seconds-min: Inactivity timeout can not be less then 1
gateway.JSONPath-hint: Supports constants and JSONPath expressions to extract data.

logs.saving-period-min: Log saving period can not be less then 1
logs.backup-count-min: Backup count can not be less then 1

gateway.max-number-of-workers-hint:
Maximal number of workers threads for converters 
(The amount of workers changes dynamically, depending on load) 
Recommended amount 50-150.
gateway.max-number-of-workers-required: Max number of workers is required.
gateway.max-messages-queue-for-worker-hint:
Maximal messages count that will be in the queue 
for each converter worker.
gateway.max-messages-queue-for-worker-required: Max messages queue per worker is required.
gateway.min-pack-send-delay-required: Min pack send delay is required
gateway.min-pack-send-delay-min: Min pack send delay can not be less then 10
gateway.min-pack-send-delay-pattern: Min pack send delay is not valid
gateway.name: Name
gateway.path-hint: The path is local to the gateway file system
gateway.poll-period-error: Poll period should be at least {{min}} (ms).
gateway.port-limits-error: Port should be number from {{min}} to {{max}}.
gateway.path-to-private-key-required: Path to private key file is required.
gateway.retain-hint:
This flag tells the broker to store the message for a topic
and ensures any new client subscribing to that topic
will receive the stored message.

rpc.title: {{type}} Connector RPC parameters

hint.modbus-response-reading: RPC response will return all subtracted values from all connected devices when the reading functions are selected.
hint.modbus-writing-functions: RPC will write a filled value to all connected devices when the writing functions are selected.
hint.opc-method: A filled method name is the OPC-UA method that will processed on the server side (make sure your node has the requested method).

rpc.template-name-duplicate: Template with such name already exists, it will be updated.
rpc.json-value-invalid: JSON value has an invalid format

gateway.requests-mapping-hint: MQTT Connector requests allows you to connect, disconnect, process attribute requests from the device, handle attribute updates on the server and RPC processing configuration.
gateway.response-timeout-limits-error: Timeout must be more then {{min}} ms.
gateway.response-topic-Qos-hint: MQTT Quality of Service (QoS) is an agreement between the message sender and receiver that defines the level of delivery guarantee for a specific message.
gateway.scan-period-error: Scan period should be at least {{min}} (ms).
gateway.sub-check-period-error: Subscription check period should be at least {{min}} (ms).
gateway.send-change-data-hint: The values will be saved to the database only if they are different from the corresponding values in the previous converted message. This functionality applies to both attributes and time series in the converter output.

statistics.statistic-commands-empty: No configured statistic keys found. You can configure them in "Statistics" tab in general configuration.
statistics.name: Time series name
statistics.send-period-min: Statistic send period can not be less then 60
statistics.send-period-pattern: Statistic send period is not valid
statistics.max-payload-size-bytes-required: Max payload size in bytes is required
statistics.max-payload-size-bytes-min: Max payload size in bytes can not be less then 100
statistics.max-payload-size-bytes-pattern: Max payload size in bytes is not valid
statistics.min-pack-size-to-send-required: Min packet size to send is required
statistics.min-pack-size-to-send-min: Min packet size to send can not be less then 100
statistics.min-pack-size-to-send-pattern: Min packet size to send is not valid
statistics.check-connectors-configuration-min: Check connectors configuration can not be less then 1
statistics.check-connectors-configuration-pattern: Check connectors configuration is not valid
statistics.timeout-min: Timeout can not be less then 1
statistics.time-series-name-pattern: Time series name is not valid

gateway.storage-max-read-record-count: Max read record count in storage
gateway.storage-max-read-record-count-required: Max Read record count is required.
gateway.storage-pack-size-required: Maximum event pack size is required.

report-strategy.label: Report strategy
report-strategy.on-change-or-report-period: On value change or report period

gateway.tls-path-ca-certificate: Path to CA certificate on gateway
gateway.tls-path-client-certificate: Path to client certificate on gateway
gateway.method-filter-hint: Regular expression to filter incoming RPC method from platform.
gateway.messages-ttl-check-in-hours-required: Messages TTL check in hours is required.
gateway.messages-ttl-in-days-required: Messages TTL in days is required.
gateway.size-limit-hint: Maximum size of each SQLite file in megabytes. When exceeded, triggers rotation to a new DB file.
gateway.max-db-amount-hint: Maximum number of rotated DB files to keep on disk. When reached, further writes are dropped until cleanup.
gateway.oversize-check-period-hint: How frequently (in minutes) to check the current DB’s file size against size_limit.
gateway.writing-batch-size-hint: Maximum number of messages collected before writing to the DB during single write request.
gateway.mqtt-qos-range: QoS values range is from 0 to 1
gateway.tls-path-private-key: Path to private key on gateway

hints.enable-custom-statistics: Enables collecting statistics using custom commands.
hints.buffer-size: Buffer size for received data blocks.
hints.encoding: Encoding used for writing received string data to storage.
hints.method: Name for method on a platform.
hints.modbus-master: Configuration sections for connecting to Modbus servers and reading data from them.
hints.modbus-server: Configuration section for the Modbus server, storing data and sending updates to the platform when changes occur or at fixed intervals.
hints.remote-configuration: Enables remote configuration and management of the gateway
hints.remote-shell: Enables remote control of the operating system with the gateway from the Remote Shell widget
hints.host: Hostname or IP address of platform server
hints.port: Port of MQTT service on platform server
hints.token: Access token for the gateway from platform server
hints.client-id: MQTT client id for the gateway form platform server
hints.username: MQTT username for the gateway form platform server
hints.password: MQTT password for the gateway form platform server
hints.data-folder: Path to the folder that will contain data (Relative or Absolute)
hints.remote-log: Enables remote logging and logs reading from the gateway
hints.backup-count: If backup count is > 0, when a rollover is done, no more than backup count files are kept - the oldest ones are deleted
hints.storage: Provides configuration for saving incoming data before it is sent to the platform
hints.max-file-count: Maximum number of files that will be created
hints.max-read-count: Number of messages to retrieve from the storage and send to platform
hints.max-records: Maximum count of records that will be stored in one file
hints.read-record-count: Number of messages to retrieve from the storage and send to platform
hints.max-records-count: Maximum number of data entries in storage before sending to platform
hints.ttl-check-hour: How often will the Gateway check data for obsolescence
hints.ttl-messages-day: Maximum number of days that the storage will retain data
hints.username-required-with-password: Username required if password is specified
hints.command: The result of the command execution, will be used as the value for telemetry
hints.check-device-activity: Enables monitor the activity of each connected device
hints.inactivity-timeout: Time after whose the gateway will disconnect device
hints.minimal-pack-delay: Delay between sending packs of messages (Decreasing this setting results in increased CPU usage)
hints.qos: Quality of Service in MQTT messaging (0 - at most once, 1 - at least once)
hints.server-port: Network port on which GRPC server will listen for incoming connections.
hints.grpc-keep-alive-timeout: Maximum time the server should wait for a keepalive ping response before considering the connection dead.
hints.grpc-keep-alive: Duration between two successive keepalive ping messages when there is no active RPC call.
hints.grpc-min-time-between-pings: Minimum amount of time the server should wait between sending keepalive ping messages
hints.grpc-max-pings-without-data: Maximum number of keepalive ping messages that the server can send without receiving any data before it considers the connection dead.
hints.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data: Minimum amount of time the server should wait between sending keepalive ping messages when there is no data being sent or received.
hints.permit-without-calls: Allow server to keep the GRPC connection alive even when there are no active RPC calls.
hints.memory: Your data will be stored in the in-memory queue, it is a fastest but no persistence guarantee.
hints.file: Your data will be stored in separated files and will be saved even after the gateway restart.
hints.sqlite: Your data will be stored in file based database. And will be saved even after the gateway restart.
hints.opc-timeout: Timeout in milliseconds for connecting to OPC-UA server.
hints.security-policy: Security Policy defines the security mechanisms to be applied.
hints.install-cmd: Packages that will be installed for command executing.
hints.scan-period: Period in milliseconds to rescan the server.
hints.sub-check-period: Period to check the subscriptions in the OPC-UA server.
hints.enable-subscription: If true - the gateway will subscribe to interesting nodes and wait for data update and if false - the gateway will rescan OPC-UA server every scanPeriodInMillis.
hints.method-name: Name of method on OPC-UA server.
hints.arguments: Arguments for the method (will be overwritten by arguments from the RPC request).
hints.poll-period: Period in milliseconds to read data from nodes.
hints.report-period-range: Report period must be greater than 100.

socket.attribute-requests-type: The type of requested attribute can be “shared” or “client.“
socket.with-response: Boolean flag that specifies whether to send a response back to platform.

modbus.bit-target-type: The response type can be either an integer (1/0) or a boolean (True/False).
modbus.bit: Specify the index of the bit to read from the array, or leave it blank to read the entire array.
modbus.max-bit: The bit value must not exceed the objects count.
modbus.framer-type: Type of a framer (Socket, RTU, or ASCII), if needed.
modbus.host: Hostname or IP address of Modbus server.
modbus.connection-timeout: Connection timeout (in seconds) for the Modbus server.
modbus.word-order: Word order when reading multiple registers.
modbus.retries: Retrying data transmission to the master. Acceptable values: true or false.
modbus.retries-on-empty: Retry sending data to the master if the data is empty.
modbus.retries-on-invalid: Retry sending data to the master if it fails.
modbus.poll-period: Period in milliseconds to check attributes and telemetry on the slave.
modbus.connect-attempt-time: A waiting period in milliseconds before establishing a connection to the master.
modbus.connect-attempt-count: The number of connection attempts made through the gateway.
modbus.wait-after-failed-attempts: A waiting period in milliseconds before attempting to send data to the master.
modbus.baudrate: Baud rate for the serial device.
modbus.stopbits: The number of stop bits sent after each character in a message to indicate the end of the byte.
modbus.bytesize: The number of bits in a byte of serial data. This can be one of 5, 6, 7, or 8.
modbus.parity: The type of checksum used to verify data integrity. Options: (E)ven, (O)dd, (N)one.
modbus.key: Key to be used as the attribute key for the platform instance.
modbus.method: Method name to be used for the platform instance.
modbus.data-keys: For more information about function codes and data types click on help icon
modbus.modifier: The retrieved value will be adjusted (by multiplying or dividing it) based on the specified modifier value.

bacnet.object-id: The gateway object identifier in the BACnet network.
bacnet.vendor-id: The gateway vendor identifier in the BACnet network
bacnet.segmentation: Segmentation type for transmitting large BACnet messages.
bacnet.key-object-id: Object id in the BACnet device.
bacnet.property-id: Property id in the BACnet device.
bacnet.request-type: “writeProperty” to write data and “readProperty” to read data.
bacnet.request-timeout: Timeout to wait the response from the BACnet device, milliseconds.
bacnet.device-timeout: Period of time when the connector will try to discover BACnet devices.
